intro: Trianthema triquetrum var. sanguineum, commonly known as the red-stemmed trianthema, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features slender, often reddish stems and small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed areas.
